posts.title: A Spooky Story
posts.description: One that terrifies us all... having to grep that impenetrable log file by hand. Is using a custom Log4j appender the way to avoid this nightmare? Is routing log events to a HTTP server a good idea or a hidden maintenance trap? Let's have a look at it.

posts.title: DORA Metrics Meet Governance in Banking
posts.description: Mike Long, Nathan Harvey and I discuss how DORA metrics can be aligned with governance frameworks in the banking industry. We posted the resulting article under the Team Topologies Expert View series.

posts.title: Bank on Tech Panel Discussion
posts.description: Deutsche Bank's Bank on Tech event in London, Birmingham, and Dublin brought together technical experts and thought leaders to reflect and learn.

posts.title: Don't name classes 'Impl'
posts.description: Naming implementation classes 'Impl' obscures intent. Learn why descriptive implementation names matter and how to choose names that reflect behaviour.

posts.title: Luhn Algorithm
posts.description: Compare an imperative and functional implementation of the Luhn Algorithm. See how functional programming emphasises transformations and immutability over state mutation.

posts.title: Lead Time vs Cycle Time
posts.subTitle: Understand the key differences between the DORA metrics that matter for software delivery
posts.description: Lead time and cycle time are often confused. Understand the subtle difference, their roots in lean manufacturing, and why DORA uses Lead Time for Changes as a key metric.

posts.title: Pull Requests and Trust
posts.subTitle: A (sketchy) History of the Pull Request
posts.description: Exploring the history and implications of pull requests in software development. This post examines how PRs introduce delays, impact continuous integration, and discusses the relationship between trust and code review practices in agile teams.

posts.title: Evidencing Source Code Reviews
posts.description: How to evidence source code reviews in regulated environments. Signed commits and pair programming as a code review mechanism without wasteful bureaucracy.

posts.title: Creating Debian Repositories
posts.description: Step-by-step guide to building and publishing your own Debian/Ubuntu APT repository with aptly, including package publishing, signing with GPG, and client setup.

posts.title: Easily Deploy Java to Debian
posts.subTitle: Package and distribute Java applications via .deb files and apt repositories
posts.description: Package Java, Scala, or Kotlin apps as .deb files and deploy via apt. Level up your distribution strategy with proper Debian package management.

posts.title: Upgrade Raspbian
posts.subTitle: Stretch to Buster
posts.description: Step-by-step guide to upgrading Raspbian from Stretch to Buster on your Raspberry Pi.

posts.title: Refactoring in 10 Minutes
posts.description: An introduction to refactoring in 10 minutes. Java examples from Martin Fowler's book, plus a free xpdojo.org collection of XP training materials.
